intro: Pleurothallis hebesepala, commonly known as the pink-veined orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on tree branches or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features a short, slender stem with a few leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers with pink and white petals. Its flowers are usually small, measuring about 1–2 centimeters in diameter, and bloom during the wet season. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular species among orchid enthusiasts and conservationists.
